newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Sydkraft buys Orebro Energi 2.3 bln SKR.
newsitem.headline: Sydkraft buys Orebro Energi 2.3 bln SKR.

text.p: Swedish power group Sydkraft on Tuesday said it had bought Orebro Energi for 2.3 billion crowns in an agreement finalised late on Monday night.
The acquisition takes effect from January 31 next year and assumes the approval of both Sydkraft's and Orebro's local authority boards.
Orebro Energi has about 370 employees, 83,000 electricity customers and 3,700 thermal customers.
Its turnover was over one billion crowns and profit after financial items about 160 million crowns in 1995.
"The company is a strong footing for us in the expanding area in middle Sweden." said Sydkraft's managing director Goran Ahlstrom.
"To date we have built up our Swedish business in southern Sweden and around Sundsvall where for example all our hydroelectric power is concentrated in our unit Bakab Energi.
"Other subsidiaries like Sydkraft Konsult, Nordkraft Service and Sydkraft Matteknik have been established in the middle of northern Sweden and they are expanding."
"We think that the Orebro region can see a similar development and become Sydkraft's third power centre."
The company estimated that electricity and heating prices would develop reasonably in the Orebro region.
